Title.evidence: Impact of Diabetes Mellitus on Left Ventricular Assist Device Outcomes: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: Participants included patients with advanced HF eligible for LVAD implantation.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received standard LVAD therapy, while the control group received LVAD therapy with additional DM management.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to elucidate the impact of DM on LVAD outcomes.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in hemoglobin A1c levels over 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised, with 100 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed a significant decrease in A1c levels (mean difference = 1.2%, 95% CI 0.8 to 1.6; p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were more frequent in the control group, with 10% experiencing major infections compared to 5% in the intervention group.

Funding.evidence: Funding: This study was funded by the National Institutes of Health.
